name: Jollof Rice
description: A classic West African rice dish cooked with tomatoes and spices.
ingredients: 1 cup of chicken or vegetable stock
instructions: 1. Rinse the rice thoroughly and set aside. 2. Heat vegetable oil in a pot and sauté diced onions until translucent. 3. Add blended tomatoes, bell peppers, and spices (thyme, curry powder, salt) to the pot. 4. Cook the sauce on medium heat until it thickens. 5. Stir in chicken or vegetable stock, then add the rice. 6. Cover and simmer on low heat until the rice is cooked and has absorbed the flavors. 7. Stir gently to combine the rice and sauce evenly. 8. Serve hot with fried plantains, chicken, or fish.

name: Fried Rice
description: A savory dish of rice stir-fried with vegetables and seasonings.
ingredients: 1 cup of diced carrots and peas
1 cup of cooked chicken or shrimp
instructions: 1. Cook the rice ahead of time and let it cool to prevent clumping. 2. Heat vegetable oil in a large pan or wok. 3. Sauté diced carrots, peas, and other vegetables of choice until tender. 4. Push the vegetables to one side of the pan and scramble eggs in the empty space. 5. Add cooked chicken or shrimp and stir to combine. 6. Mix in the rice and drizzle soy sauce over the mixture. 7. Stir-fry everything together until evenly coated and heated through. 8. Serve hot as a main dish or side.

name: Yam and Egg Sauce
description: Boiled yam served with a delicious egg and tomato sauce.
instructions: 1. Peel and cut the yam into slices, then boil in salted water until soft. 2. In a separate pan, heat vegetable oil and sauté diced onions. 3. Add chopped tomatoes and season with salt and pepper. Cook until the tomatoes break down. 4. Crack eggs into the pan and stir gently to create a scrambled consistency. 5. Cook until the eggs are fully set and well mixed with the tomato sauce. 6. Serve the boiled yam alongside the egg sauce.

name: Pizza
description: A delicious baked flatbread typically topped with tomato sauce, cheese, and various toppings.
instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 450°F (230°C). 2. Roll out the pizza dough on a floured surface into your desired shape. 3. Spread tomato sauce evenly over the dough. 4. Sprinkle shredded mozzarella cheese generously on top. 5. Add your favorite toppings such as pepperoni, mushrooms, or bell peppers. 6. Drizzle a little olive oil over the toppings for extra flavor. 7. Bake in the preheated oven for 10-15 minutes or until the crust is golden and the cheese is melted. 8. Slice and serve immediately.

name: Burger
description: A savory sandwich consisting of a cooked patty of ground meat, placed inside a sliced bread roll or bun.
ingredients: 1 lb of ground beef or chicken
instructions: 1. Season ground beef or chicken with salt, pepper, and any desired spices. Form into patties. 2. Heat a skillet or grill over medium-high heat and cook the patties for 4-5 minutes per side or until done. 3. Toast the burger buns lightly on the grill or in the oven. 4. Assemble the burger by layering lettuce, tomato slices, the cooked patty, and a slice of cheese on the bottom bun. 5. Spread ketchup, mayonnaise, or mustard on the top bun and place it over the fillings. 6. Serve immediately with fries or a side salad.

name: Potato Salad
description: A creamy and tangy salad made with boiled potatoes, mayonnaise, and seasonings.
instructions: 1. Peel and dice potatoes into bite-sized cubes, then boil until tender. 2. In a large bowl, combine mayonnaise, mustard, salt, pepper, and chopped parsley or chives. 3. Gently fold the boiled potatoes into the mixture until evenly coated. 4. Cover and refrigerate for at least an hour before serving to allow the flavors to blend. 5. Serve cold as a side dish or appetizer.

name: Stir-Fried Noodles
description: A flavorful dish of noodles stir-fried with vegetables and protein in a savory sauce.
ingredients: 1 cup of mixed vegetables (carrots, bell peppers, broccoli)
1 cup of cooked chicken, shrimp, or tofu
instructions: 1. Cook the noodles according to package instructions and drain. 2. Heat oil in a large pan or wok and sauté minced garlic and ginger until fragrant. 3. Add sliced vegetables like carrots, bell peppers, and broccoli, and stir-fry until tender. 4. Stir in cooked chicken, shrimp, or tofu and cook for another 2 minutes. 5. Add the cooked noodles and soy sauce to the pan. Toss everything together until well combined. 6. Serve immediately with a sprinkle of sesame seeds or green onions.

name: Shrimp Linguine Pasta
description: Shrimp in creamy garlic butter sauce over linguine.
instructions: Cook pasta, save 1 cup pasta water.
Sauté shrimp in olive oil, set aside.
Sauté garlic, add cream, simmer.
Stir in Parmesan, chili flakes, shrimp, and pasta.
Garnish with parsley and serve.

name: Scrambled Eggs with Bacon and Toast
description: Fluffy eggs, crispy bacon, and buttered toast.
image: assets/images/scrambled eggs with bacon and toast.jpg
instructions: Cook bacon, set aside.
Whisk eggs, milk, salt, and pepper.
Scramble eggs in butter, remove when slightly runny.
Toast bread and butter.
Serve eggs with bacon and toast.

name: Edikang Ikong Soup
description: Nigerian vegetable soup with meats and seafood.
instructions: Cook meats and fish with seasoning until tender.
Sauté onions, peppers, crayfish in palm oil.
Add meats, stock, waterleaf, and pumpkin leaves.
Simmer, adjust seasoning, and serve with pounded yam, fufu, or eba.

name: Fisherman Soup
description: Spicy seafood soup with fish, prawns, and crab.
instructions: Season and set aside fish.
Sauté onions, peppers in palm oil.
Add water, crayfish, uziza seeds, and seasoning, boil.
Add fish and prawns, cook until tender.
Add waterleaf, simmer, and serve with yam, rice, or swallow.
